flawed_nl_solution:
Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day 6 * 2 * 2 = <<6*2*2=24>>24.
On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish 24 / 3 = <<24/3=8.0>>8.0.
So at the end of day three, he has 24 - 8.0 = <<24-8.0=61.0>>61.0 fish.
On day five he has 61.0 * 2 * 2 = 244.0 fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
So he took out 244.0 / 4 = <<244.0/4=61.0>>61.0 fishes.
So at the end of day five, he has 244.0 - 61.0 = <<244.0-61.0=183.0>>183.0 fish.
On day seven he has 183.0 * 2 * 2 = <<183.0*2*2=732.0>>732.0 fish.
He adds in 15 more, so he has 732.0 + 15 = <<732.0+15=747.0>>747.0 fish in total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16.0, not 61.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
